text: Mr. Pye is a Channel 4 television series written by Donald Churchill, based on the 1953 short novel Mr. Pye by Mervyn Peake, and directed by Michael Darlow.The Guardian: Catch-up TV guide: from Sherlock to Mr Pye Broadcast began on 2 March 1986 in the United Kingdom. ==Plot== Mr. Pye travels to the Channel Island of Sark to preach the word of God. Pye does good works and he discovers that he has started to grow angel's wings, and after consulting with a Harley Street doctor, he decides to stop doing good deeds, and instead does bad deeds. He engages in some deliberately malicious acts, and after a while this results in him growing horns on his forehead. He is unable to decide what to do, but eventually decides to reveal his horned condition to the islanders, who chase him to the edge of a cliff, which Pye flies off using his wings. ==Cast== * Derek Jacobi as Mr. Pye * Judy Parfitt as Miss Dredger * Betty Marsden as Miss George * Richard O'Callaghan as Thorpe ==Production== The series was filmed on Sark island itself, the setting of the book.Carl Hester, Bernadette Hewitt, 2014, "Making it Happen: The Autobiography", Orion Press. ==Episodes== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |- style="color:#fff;" ! style="background:#FF5F5F;"| Episode ! style="background:#FF5F5F;"| Title ! style="background:#FF5F5F;"| Written by ! style="background:#FF5F5F;"| Directed by ! style="background:#FF5F5F;"| Original air date ! style="background:#FF5F5F;"| Ratings |} ==References== ==External links== * * Channel 4 on Demand: Mr. Pye * The Making of Mr. Pye Category:1986 British television series debuts Category:1986 British television series endings Category:1980s British television miniseries Category:English-language television shows Category:British television miniseries Category:Television shows based on British novels Category:High fantasy television series
